introArchetypes.title: Tarot as Archetypal Language
introArchetypes.oneLiner: Tarot as a symbolic mirror â€” not a certainty machine.
introArchetypes.body:
Tarot and Jung speak the same native tongue: symbols.

Tarot works best when you stop treating it like a prediction device and start using it as a mirror. A card image doesnâ€™t hand you certainty â€” it highlights a pattern: a fear, a desire, a conflict, a value, a blind spot.

A simple archetypal way to read:
1) Name the tension: What is the living question here?
2) Spot the role: Who am I being in this story (Hero, Caretaker, Trickster, Judge, Lover)?
3) Choose a behavior: What is one action that matches my values â€” even 1%?

Common trap: asking Tarot to calm anxiety (â€œTell me what will happen so I can relax.â€). That often makes the mind more dependent on certainty. A Jung-informed reading does the opposite: it returns agency.

â€¢ Write one sentence: â€œRight now Iâ€™m afraid thatâ€¦â€

â€¢ Finally: â€œMy next honest step isâ€¦â€

persona.title: Persona
persona.oneLiner: The role you perform â€” useful until it becomes a cage.
persona.body:
Jung used the word Persona to describe the â€œsocial maskâ€ we wear to function in the world. Itâ€™s not fake â€” itâ€™s adaptive. The problem starts when you confuse the mask with the whole face.

Persona says: â€œBe competent.â€ â€œBe good.â€ â€œBe the strong one.â€ â€œBe the chill one.â€ It helps you belong. But if you over-identify with it, it becomes a cage: you perform instead of relate.

In Tarot, Persona themes often show up as structure, rules, reputation, and judgment â€” cards like The Emperor (control/role), The Hierophant (norms/approval), and Justice (image, fairness, correctness). None of these are â€˜badâ€™ â€” they become heavy when theyâ€™re the only way you know how to be.

Signs youâ€™re stuck in Persona:
â€¢ You feel safe only when youâ€™re impressive, useful, or agreeable.
â€¢ You hide needs until they become resentment.

1) Name the role: â€œIâ€™m acting as the ____.â€ (Leader, Helper, Good Child, Expert, Peacemakerâ€¦)
2) Name what it protects: â€œThis role protects me from ____.â€ (rejection, conflict, shame, failureâ€¦)
3) Do 10% more truth: one small act of honest presence (a clear boundary, a real feeling, a simple request).

Persona becomes healthy again when itâ€™s a tool â€” not an identity. You can still be respected *and* real. That combination is where relationships and decisions get lighter.

shadow.title: Shadow
shadow.oneLiner: What you reject or hide often returns as a trigger.

The Shadow is the part of you that got exiled: traits, needs, emotions, desires, and impulses that didnâ€™t feel â€œsafeâ€ to show.

â€¢ overreactions (a small thing feels huge)
â€¢ shame loops
â€¢ self-sabotage

animaAnimus.title: Anima & Animus (Inner Polarity)
animaAnimus.oneLiner: Inner polarity shapes attraction, conflict, and creativity.
animaAnimus.body:
Jung used Anima/Animus to describe inner polarity: complementary energies inside you (receptive/active, intuitive/rational, feeling/deciding). Itâ€™s not about gender â€” itâ€™s about balance.

â€¢ you seek it obsessively in partners
â€¢ you resent people who embody it

â€¢ The Lovers = choice + integration (not just romance).

â€¢ Too much Chariot: controlling, pushing, never receiving.

self.title: The Self (Integration)
self.oneLiner: Integration and alignment â€” the feeling of inner coherence.
self.body:
In Jungian terms, the Self is not the ego. The ego is who you think you are today; the Self is the organizing center of wholeness â€” the feeling of being aligned inside.

â€¢ constant second-guessing
â€¢ people-pleasing

â€¢ separating your values from other peopleâ€™s expectations

hero.title: The Hero
hero.body:
The Hero archetype is the part of you that can start, persist, and grow stronger through challenge.

wiseGuide.title: The Wise Guide
wiseGuide.oneLiner: Discernment, study, and honest inner listening.
wiseGuide.body:

â€¢ â€œLook again.â€

trickster.title: The Trickster
trickster.oneLiner: Disruption that can free you â€” or trip you.

greatMother.title: The Great Mother (Nurture vs Control)
greatMother.oneLiner: Care, protection, and the shadow of over-control.

â€¢ keeps you dependent

deathRenewal.title: Death & Renewal
deathRenewal.oneLiner: Endings that create space for the next honest phase.

projection.title: Projection (Seeing Yourself in Others)
projection.oneLiner: Projection turns inner material into external drama.
